channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: something funny. A semi-famous pundit took an ad on Facebook. This person had been incredibly obnoxious to me, on Twitter, jaw-dropping obnoxious. Over on Facebook I chose the menu item asking why I was seeing this ad. said she wanted to reach people like herself. Ohdeeohdoh!

or fly through the physical world with one of millions of drones scattered all over the planet and in earth orbit. With appropriate ads of course.

Adding new glop to programming languages is easy. Factoring so you don't need the glop is hard and gets harder with each new layer of glop that is added.
Maybe asking JavaScript to do everything you ever wanted to do with a language is the same mistake that was made turning XML-RPC into SOAP with all its WSDLness (and all the glop that followed WSDL).
In fact the evolution of JS under the tutelage of Big Tech looks very much like a replay of SOAP to me.
I'd like to go the other way, see what we can live without and come up with a simple core that we use to get interop between codebases.
In SOAP time we called that the BDG, or "Busy Developer's Guide" to whatever. In that case SOAP.
It made it possible to deploy SOAP apps without waiting for the deliberations (and breakage) to complete.
Most of the people who work on big specs for big companies are not the people who build apps, they have full time jobs working on adding glop to the platforms.
I think back in the day I served as a proxy for things people inside Microsoft couldn't get permission to do. So they invited me to join knowing I wouldn't want to go to endless committee meetings, which I don't.
I couldn't say that then, back in the late 90s, I had to cover for my friends. But that's so ancient, perhaps now the truth can be told. Inside the bigco's often there lurk people who just want to make apps. ;-)
Anyway, the point is this, if you want to add strong typing to JS, why not instead just use a language that has strong typing, instead of adding more layers of glop to an already glop-saturated language.
Here's an archive of the SOAP BDG.
https://t.co/MmGm1ef7i6

The last few days have been the first time I've seen anything on TV about what Russians are like. Kind of amazing when you think about it. What if we could organize politics across the nuclear boundaries. If they can't speak at home at least we can give them space here.
Maybe not so much in the middle of the US, but where I come from there are lots of people of Russian descent. Their faces look familiar to me, like I could see them on the subway. It's where my family comes from, I'm first gen American.
@TaylorLorenz I guess I'd better get on Telegram. Wonder if they have an API.

A summary of the VC business model. Take an idea that was developed on the open internet, without lock-in, then fund a startup to do the same thing, with lock-in and don't change the name. https://t.co/VRtl7uubC0
